title: [jit] allow passing in Python numbers as arguments (upcast to tensors)
body_html:
Repro:

import torch
@torch.jit.script
def add(x, y):
    return x + y

x = torch.tensor(torch.arange(0, 10), requires_grad=True)
y = 1
add(x, y)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-15-9234d4f899b6> in <module>()
      7 y = 1
      8 # y = torch.randn((), requires_grad=True)
----> 9 add(x, y)

RuntimeError: Unable to cast Python instance to C++ type (compile in debug mode for details)

This should probably have a nicer error (say something about only accepting tensor arguments), or accept numbers

cc @zdevito

body:
Repro:
```
import torch
@torch.jit.script
def add(x, y):
    return x + y

x = torch.tensor(torch.arange(0, 10), requires_grad=True)
y = 1
add(x, y)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-15-9234d4f899b6> in <module>()
      7 y = 1
      8 # y = torch.randn((), requires_grad=True)
----> 9 add(x, y)

RuntimeError: Unable to cast Python instance to C++ type (compile in debug mode for details)
```

This should probably have a nicer error (say something about only accepting tensor arguments), or accept numbers

cc @zdevito
